result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathon William Griffith

2:33 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin, Defendant Jonathon William Griffith appeared by video means. Set for STC. DE did not appear in person in court. Clerk called hallway. State requests warrant. Court issues WARRANT - body only, adjoining states. Adjourned: 2:34 PM. Case recalled - 2:37 PM. DE appeared by Zoom. QUASH WARRANT. DE states that his employment status will be changing soon. Court advises DE to contact public defender's office or file PFAC. Court sets STC to check on attorney status, Zoom approved. Adjourned: 2:40 PM. kma

The original document was titled: Pretrial Assessment Report
The original history event date is: 08-02-2022

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant. 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Fleet Farm.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

1:23 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Christianson.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Jonathon William Griffith. Defendant Jonathon William Griffith in court, in custody. DE confirms address and DOB. DE understands charges and possible penalties. Waive reading. Defendant doesn't qualify for PD- PFAC given. Bond argument. Court orders bond. Court sets STC and PSC. Waives prelim time limits. Adjourned
